name: Playboi Carti
description:
'''Jordan Terrell Carter''' (born September 13, 1995, or 1996),{{Efn|name=Birth year citations|Reliable sources report 1995 or 1996 as the birth year.<ref>Birth year citations:
*{{cite web |last=Yeung |first=Neil Z. |title=Playboi Carti |url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/playboi-carti-mn0003569215 |access-date=November 21, 2019 |publisher=[[AllMusic]]}} Birth date reported as September 13, 1995. 
* {{Cite news |last=Detrick |first=Ben |date=June 29, 2018 |title=Playboi Carti Conquers the Paris Runway |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/29/style/playboi-carti-louis-vuitton-virgil-abloh-paris-mens-fashion-week.html |access-date=January 14, 2023 |work=The New York Times |language=en-US |issn=0362-4331}} Reported 21 years old in June 2018.
* {{cite web |last1=Schwadron |first1=Eli |date=September 13, 2016 |title=Happy Birthday, Playboi Carti! |url=https://www.xxlmag.com/news/2016/09/happy-birthday-playboi-carti/ |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160914165512/https://www.xxlmag.com/news/2016/09/happy-birthday-playboi-carti/ |archive-date=September 14, 2016 |website=XXL Magazine}} Reported turning 20 years old on September 13, 2016.
* {{Cite magazine |title=Playboi Carti {{!}} Biography, Music & News |url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/playboi-carti/ |access-date=January 13, 2024 |magazine=Billboard |language=en-US}} Birth date reported as September 13, 1996.
* {{cite web |last1=Shahnavaz |first1=Nazanin |date=May 8, 2020 |title=Playboi Carti Discusses Social Media and the Afterlife |url=https://www.ssense.com/en-us/editorial/music/rap-game-reincarnation |website=Ssense}} Birth date reported as September 13, 1996.
* {{cite magazine |last=Young |first=Alex |date=February 14, 2023 |title=Playboi Carti Charged with Felony Aggravated Assault |url=https://consequence.net/2023/02/playboi-carti-felony-aggravated-assault/ |access-date=March 7, 2024 |magazine=[[Consequence of Sound]]}} Reported 26 years old in February 2023.
* {{cite news |last=Geddes |first=Bob |date=January 17, 2019 |title=US rapper Playboi Carti trashed tour bus and punched driver at Gretna services in diva strop |url=https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/scottish-news/rapper-playboi-carti-trashed-tour-13871687 |access-date=March 7, 2024 |newspaper=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|Daily Record]]}} Reported 22 years old in January 2019.</ref>}} known professionally as '''Playboi Carti''', is an American rapper. Known for his eccentric vocal style and fashion, he is considered an influential figure in modern [[hip-hop]] and a pioneer of the [[Rage (music genre)|rage]] microgenre. His music has been characterized as atmospheric and avant-garde, often marked by unconventional vocal techniques such as his "baby voice", with critics highlighting his focus on mood and persona over traditional lyricism.

Born and raised in [[Atlanta]], Georgia, Carter began his musical career under the stage name '''Sir Cartier''' in 2011, [[self-releasing]] early tracks on [[SoundCloud]]. He signed with [[Awful Records]] in 2014 and later with [[ASAP Rocky]]'s AWGE imprint, a joint venture with [[Interscope Records]], in 2016. Carter gained mainstream attention with his [[Playboi Carti (mixtape)|eponymous debut mixtape]] (2017), which peaked at number 12 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and produced the singles "[[Magnolia (Playboi Carti song)|Magnolia]]" and "[[Wokeuplikethis]]" (featuring [[Lil Uzi Vert]]). His debut studio album, ''[[Die Lit]]'' (2018), was met with commercial success, debuting at number three on the ''Billboard'' 200.

His second album, ''[[Whole Lotta Red]]'' (2020), became his first number-one album on the ''Billboard'' 200 and was later ranked among the greatest hip-hop albums by ''[[Rolling Stone]]''. After a series of high-profile collaborations, including [[Travis Scott]]'s "[[Fein (song)|Fein]]" (2024) and [[Kanye West]] and [[Ty Dolla Sign]]'s "[[Carnival (¥$ song)|Carnival]]" (2024)—the latter becoming his first number-one single on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]—Carter released his third album, ''[[Music (Playboi Carti album)|Music]]'' (2025). The album received generally positive reviews and became his second consecutive number-one on the ''Billboard'' 200. It yielded the [[Promotional recording|promotional single]], "[[Evil J0rdan]]", which debuted at number two on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100.

Aside from his recording career, Carter founded the record label and rap collective [[Opium (record label)|Opium]] in 2019, which has signed artists including [[Ken Carson]], [[Destroy Lonely]], [[Homixide Gang]], and fellow [[ASAP Mob]] member [[ASAP Nast]].
